attributes.action: Privatise the BBC to save households £3.6bn every year
attributes.additional_details:
- The BBC license fee acts as a tax on every household in the UK.

- It sucks £150 from every household every year and a total of £3.6bn from the UK economy every year.

- This money could be used to help struggling families pay bills and create more consumer demand and economic growth.

- The BBC would still exist but would fund itself through advertising like the other media outlets.
